text: <@U01DZUA88S1> you are absolutely right to highlight how much precision of language matter in a bug report. It was educational for me to see how much it can impact everyone’s time. I did some preliminary work on this bug and have a simple solution which I need to test. Just to make sure I’m on the right track, I have a few questions: do I need a bugzilla account? what is the best practice to post in this channel, eg link to the bugzilla report? the help page on the persp() function is very explicit on the form of the list: ” If ‘x’ is a ‘list’, its components ‘x$x’ and ‘x$y’ are used for ‘x’ and ‘y’, respectively.” so I am relying on this fact in the solution. The function does most things like put in defaults for x and y silently so I will follow that design choice. (<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1161|Bug 1161> )

Hi Munawar. You will need a bugzilla account to comment on the bug report and propose a patch there, so it is worth asking for one now: <https://contributor.r-project.org/rdevguide/IssueTrack.html#bugzilla-account>.

Giving the bug number is sufficient, but a link can be helpful - perhaps you can edit your post. The convention is then to continue discussion in a thread in case someone else wants to work out loud on another issue.

Your approach to the solution sounds sensible.
